definition:
&%KatabaticWind is a downslope wind 
caused by the flow of an elevated, high-density air mass into a lower-density air mass 
below under the force of gravity. A katabatic wind originates from the difference of 
density of two air masses located above a slope. This density difference usually comes 
from temperature difference, even if humidity may also play a role. Schematically katabatic 
winds can be divided into two types for which the mechanisms are slightly different: 
the katabatic winds due to radiative cooling (the most common) and the fall winds.[Wikipedia]
